docs.text: cybergisx-cli Welcome to the documentation for cybergisx-cli! This is a Command Line Interface (CLI) for the CyberGISX platform. To learn more about CyberGISX, check out the following links: CyberGISX Hub CyberGISX CyberGIS Center The cybergisx CLI is designed to help users manage the kernels available within their container. Command Line Usage Running cybergisx from the command line should display the following help message: Usage: cybergisx.py [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]... Options: -a, --avail See available CyberGISX kernels. -i, --install TEXT Install an available kernel. -p, --personal See your personal kernels. -rp, --remove-personal TEXT Remove a personal kernel. -v, --version Show the version and exit. -h, --help Show this message and exit. -a/--avail Prints the available kernels to the terminal. cybergisx -a cybergisx --avail -i/--install TEXT Installs an available kernel (see -a/--avail ). PATH is kernel to install. cybergisx -i python3 cybergisx --install python3 -p/--personal Prints the personal kernels you have installed. cyberigsx -p cyberigsx --personal -rp/--remove-personal TEXT Removes a kernel from your list of personal kernels (see -p/--personal ). Note that this does not automatically remove the kernel from the dropdown, but it will no longer appear after a container restart unless it is a kernel installed by default cybergisx -rp cybergisx --remove-personal -v/--version Prints the version of the cybergisx command line tool. cybergisx -v cybergisx --version -h/--help Prints the help text for the cybergisx command line tool. cybergisx -h cybergisx --help
docs.title: cybergisx-cli

docs.text: Welcome to the documentation for cybergisx-cli! This is a Command Line Interface (CLI) for the CyberGISX platform. To learn more about CyberGISX, check out the following links: CyberGISX Hub CyberGISX CyberGIS Center The cybergisx CLI is designed to help users manage the kernels available within their container.

docs.text: Running cybergisx from the command line should display the following help message: Usage: cybergisx.py [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]... Options: -a, --avail See available CyberGISX kernels. -i, --install TEXT Install an available kernel. -p, --personal See your personal kernels. -rp, --remove-personal TEXT Remove a personal kernel. -v, --version Show the version and exit. -h, --help Show this message and exit.
docs.title: Command Line Usage

docs.text: Prints the available kernels to the terminal. cybergisx -a cybergisx --avail
docs.title: -a/--avail

docs.text: Installs an available kernel (see -a/--avail ). PATH is kernel to install. cybergisx -i python3 cybergisx --install python3
docs.title: -i/--install TEXT

docs.text: Prints the personal kernels you have installed. cyberigsx -p cyberigsx --personal
docs.title: -p/--personal

docs.text: Removes a kernel from your list of personal kernels (see -p/--personal ). Note that this does not automatically remove the kernel from the dropdown, but it will no longer appear after a container restart unless it is a kernel installed by default cybergisx -rp cybergisx --remove-personal
docs.title: -rp/--remove-personal TEXT

docs.text: Prints the version of the cybergisx command line tool. cybergisx -v cybergisx --version
docs.title: -v/--version

docs.text: Prints the help text for the cybergisx command line tool. cybergisx -h cybergisx --help
docs.title: -h/--help
